trans-unit.source: Defining dependencies in Azure Resource Manager templates
trans-unit.target: Defining dependencies in Azure Resource Manager templates

trans-unit.source: Describes how to set one resource as dependent on another resource during deployment.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to set one resource as dependent on another resource during deployment.

trans-unit.source: For a given resource, there can be multiple upstream and child dependencies that are critical to the success of your topology.
trans-unit.target: For a given resource, there can be multiple upstream and child dependencies that are critical to the success of your topology.

trans-unit.source: You can define dependencies on other resources using dependsOn and resources property of a resource.
trans-unit.target: You can define dependencies on other resources using dependsOn and resources property of a resource.

trans-unit.source: A dependency can also be specified using the reference function.
trans-unit.target: A dependency can also be specified using the reference function.

trans-unit.source: There are also resource links which can define relationships between resources, and support defining these relationships across resource groups.
trans-unit.target: There are also resource links which can define relationships between resources, and support defining these relationships across resource groups.

trans-unit.source: For a given virtual machine, you may be dependent on having a database resource successfully provisioned.
trans-unit.target: For a given virtual machine, you may be dependent on having a database resource successfully provisioned.

trans-unit.source: In another case, you may be dependent for multiple nodes in your cluster to be installed before deploying a virtual machine with the cluster management tool.
trans-unit.target: In another case, you may be dependent for multiple nodes in your cluster to be installed before deploying a virtual machine with the cluster management tool.

trans-unit.source: Within your template, the dependsOn property provides the ability to define this dependency for a resource.
trans-unit.target: Within your template, the dependsOn property provides the ability to define this dependency for a resource.

trans-unit.source: It's value can be a comma separated list of resource names.
trans-unit.target: It's value can be a comma separated list of resource names.

trans-unit.source: The dependencies between resources are evaluated and resources are deployed in their dependent order.
trans-unit.target: The dependencies between resources are evaluated and resources are deployed in their dependent order.

trans-unit.source: When resources are not dependent on each other, they are attempted to be deployed in parallel.
trans-unit.target: When resources are not dependent on each other, they are attempted to be deployed in parallel.

trans-unit.source: While you may be inclined to use dependsOn to map dependencies between your resources, it's important to understand why you're doing it because it can impact the performance of your deployment.
trans-unit.target: While you may be inclined to use dependsOn to map dependencies between your resources, it's important to understand why you're doing it because it can impact the performance of your deployment.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you're doing this because you want to document how resources are interconnected, dependsOn is not the right approach.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you're doing this because you want to document how resources are interconnected, dependsOn is not the right approach.

trans-unit.source: The lifecycle of dependsOn is just for deployment and is not available post-deployment.
trans-unit.target: The lifecycle of dependsOn is just for deployment and is not available post-deployment.

trans-unit.source: Once deployed there is no way to query these dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Once deployed there is no way to query these dependencies.

trans-unit.source: By using dependsOn you run the risk of impacting performance where you may inadvertently distract the deployment engine from using parallelism where it might have otherwise.
trans-unit.target: By using dependsOn you run the risk of impacting performance where you may inadvertently distract the deployment engine from using parallelism where it might have otherwise.

trans-unit.source: To document and provide query capabililty over the relationships between resources, you should instead use <linkText>resource linking</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To document and provide query capabililty over the relationships between resources, you should instead use <linkText>resource linking</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This element is not needed if the reference function is used to get a representation of a resource because a reference object implies a dependency on the resource.
trans-unit.target: This element is not needed if the reference function is used to get a representation of a resource because a reference object implies a dependency on the resource.

trans-unit.source: In fact, if there is an option to use a reference vs. dependsOn, the guidance is to use the reference function and have implicit references.
trans-unit.target: In fact, if there is an option to use a reference vs. dependsOn, the guidance is to use the reference function and have implicit references.

trans-unit.source: The rationale here again is performance.
trans-unit.target: The rationale here again is performance.

trans-unit.source: References define implicit dependencies that are known to be required as they're referenced within the template.
trans-unit.target: References define implicit dependencies that are known to be required as they're referenced within the template.

trans-unit.source: By their presence, they are relevant, avoiding again optimizing for performance and to avoid the potential risk of distracting the deployment engine from avoiding parallelism unnecessarily.
trans-unit.target: By their presence, they are relevant, avoiding again optimizing for performance and to avoid the potential risk of distracting the deployment engine from avoiding parallelism unnecessarily.

trans-unit.source: The resources property allows you to specify child resources that are related to the resource being defined.
trans-unit.target: The resources property allows you to specify child resources that are related to the resource being defined.

trans-unit.source: Child resources can only be defined 5 levels deep.
trans-unit.target: Child resources can only be defined 5 levels deep.

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that an implicit dependency is not created between a child resource and the parent resource.
trans-unit.target: It is important to note that an implicit dependency is not created between a child resource and the parent resource.

trans-unit.source: If you need the child resource to be deployed after the parent resource, you must explicitly state that dependency with the dependsOn property.
trans-unit.target: If you need the child resource to be deployed after the parent resource, you must explicitly state that dependency with the dependsOn property.

trans-unit.source: The reference function enables an expression to derive its value from other JSON name and value pairs or runtime resources.
trans-unit.target: The reference function enables an expression to derive its value from other JSON name and value pairs or runtime resources.

trans-unit.source: Reference expressions implicitly declare that one resource depends on another.
trans-unit.target: Reference expressions implicitly declare that one resource depends on another.

trans-unit.source: The property represented by propertyPath below is optional, if it is not specified, the reference is to the resource.
trans-unit.target: The property represented by propertyPath below is optional, if it is not specified, the reference is to the resource.

trans-unit.source: You can use either this element or the dependsOn element to specify dependencies, but you do not need to use both for the same dependent resource.
trans-unit.target: You can use either this element or the dependsOn element to specify dependencies, but you do not need to use both for the same dependent resource.

trans-unit.source: The guidance is to use the implicit reference to avoid the risk of inadvertently having an unnecessary dependsOn element stop the deployment engine from doing aspects of the deployment in parallel.
trans-unit.target: The guidance is to use the implicit reference to avoid the risk of inadvertently having an unnecessary dependsOn element stop the deployment engine from doing aspects of the deployment in parallel.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see <linkText>reference function</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see <linkText>reference function</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To learn about creating Azure Resource Manager templates, see <linkText>Authoring templates</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn about creating Azure Resource Manager templates, see <linkText>Authoring templates</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For a list of the available functions in a template, see <linkText>Template functions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of the available functions in a template, see <linkText>Template functions</linkText><title></title>.
